alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Crittenden and western Shelby Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crawfordsville, or 7 miles northwest of Marion, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Marion, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Memphis, Crawfordsville, Sunset, Jericho, Turrell, Clarkedale, Mound City, Booker, Gammon, Cunningham Corner, St Clair, Harvard, Presidents Island, Briark, Locke, Vincent and Hulbert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and west Tennessee.
